title: 109_hr3988
content:
The Act titled "Gulf Coast Small Business Recovery Act" prioritizes small businesses in procurement related to Hurricane Katrina and Hurricane Rita. The "Gulf Coast Small Business Recovery Act" prioritizes businesses in Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas for procurement related to Hurricane Katrina and Hurricane Rita, requiring a minimum of 30% small business participation in prime contracts. The "Gulf Coast Small Business Recovery Act" mandates that a minimum of 30% of prime contract amounts and 40% of subcontract amounts for Hurricane Katrina and Rita reconstruction be awarded to small businesses in Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas, with a focus on maximizing small business participation and compliance with subcontracting goals. The head of a Federal department or agency must ensure that contracts meet subcontracting goals for small businesses under the Small Business Act and Federal Acquisition Regulations. The Administrator of the Small Business Administration must submit a report to Congress within 2 years, detailing opportunities for small businesses. This subsection will end one day after all Federal Disaster Declaration notices for Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas are lifted. SEC. 3. Gulf hurricane disaster-affected small businesses treated as HUBZone for Small Business Act purposes. Applies during Federal Disaster Declaration period for affected counties as of August 28, 2005.

SEC. 4. Prohibits permanent relocation of federal facilities from Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas. Prohibition on permanent relocation of federal facilities from Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas, with termination after two years. Reports required for facilities temporarily relocated for over 6 months. The Committee on Homeland Security and Government Affairs requires reports on the temporary relocation of federal facilities from Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas to locations outside the area, with additional reports every 6 months for the duration of the relocation period. SEC. 5. DEFINITIONS. The Act defines terms related to Gulf hurricane disasters, including "Gulf hurricane disaster-affected small business concern," "Gulf hurricane disaster," and "Gulf hurricane disaster-affected area." These terms are crucial for determining eligibility and assistance in areas affected by Hurricane Katrina or Hurricane Rita. A small business concern is defined under section 3 of the Small Business Act for disaster assistance in designated areas affected by the hurricanes. SEC. 6. EFFECTIVE DATE. This Act will be in effect 10 days after its enactment.
